sentences.en: Many of these new plants were located on navigable rivers.
sentences.cn: 这些新工厂大多都座落在通航河流的沿岸.

sentences.en: Navigable hydraulics , hydraulic engineering techniques in engineering designs , engineering project evaluation and evaluation of key courses ( engineering subjects ).
sentences.cn: 通航水力学 、 工程项目评估、工程设计中的水利工程技术,重点学科 ( 工科类 ) 评估.

sentences.en: The canal is navigable all the year.
The depth of the navigable channel of this river is 40 feet.
sentences.cn: 这条河的可航行河段的水深为40英尺.

sentences.en: The lower reaches of the river are navigable for steamers.
sentences.cn: 这河的下游能够行驶轮船.

sentences.en: The navigable channels have all been charted.
sentences.cn: 所有的航道都已绘入海图.

sentences.en: The Rhine is navigable from Strasbourg to the sea.
sentences.cn: 莱茵河从斯特拉斯堡入海这一段可以通航.

sentences.en: The river is navigable by vessels of up to 90 tons.
sentences.cn: 90吨以下的船只可以从这条河通过.

sentences.en: The river is navigable during the rainy season.
The river was navigable for 50 miles.
sentences.cn: 这条河有50英里可以通航.
这河流是可以用通航的.

sentences.en: This river is navigable for 2 v ad [ T ] kilometres.
sentences.cn: 这条河有 二百 公里可以 通航.

sentences.en: With its engine broken, this great ship was not navigable.
sentences.cn: 这条大船的马达坏了, 无法再航行了.

words.tran_cn: 耐航性；[水运][航] 适航性
驾驶，操纵；使通过；航行于
[水运][航]可航行的；可驾驶的；适于航行的

trans.tran_cn: （水域）可航行[通航]的，（船只、飞机等）可领航的，可操纵的
trans.tran_en: a river, lake etc that is navigable is deep and wide enough for ships to travel on
